action.action-desc: Mr. Stewart (for himself, Mr. Westmoreland, Mr. Culberson, Mr. Jones, Mr. Flores, Mr. Huelskamp, Mr. Kingston, Ms. Jenkins, Mr. Nunnelee, Mr. Mulvaney, Mr. Olson, Mr. Bridenstine, and Mr. Salmon) submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

form.official-title: Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives that the President should refrain from any further taxpayer-funded vacations until the White House can be re-opened for public tours.

whereas.text: Whereas the President has plans for additional vacations in the coming months;
Whereas Congress, under similar budgetary pressures, has maintained the Capitol open for public tours: Now, therefore, be it

section.text: That it is the sense of the House of Representatives that the President should refrain from any further vacations at the taxpayers’ expense until such sums have been saved that the people’s White House can be re-opened for public tours.
